name: Hardest "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" (1987) Part 1 Trivia Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Not counting the opening theme song, which of the four turtles was the first to be shown in the series?
questions.explanation:
Donatello.

	During the opening scenes of the show April O'Neil was attacked by the not yet mutated Bebop and Rocksteady. The turtles were nearby and intervened. Emerging from the shadows first was an arm holding on to a bo staff that the viewers quickly see belonged to Donatello. The pilot was called "Turtle Tracks".

questions.text: Krang was introduced in season 1, episode 2 and would be one of the main villains for the next eight seasons of the show. Who or what was Krang?
questions.correct: An evil warlord from Dimension X.
options: The name of the computer program that ran the Technodrome.
A mutated soldier in the shape of a giant "brain".
questions.explanation:
An evil warlord from Dimension X.

	Krang was based on an alien race from the original comic books, but was changed into a being from Dimension X for the animated series. He was a giant anthropomorphic brain, and in later episodes he operated a giant android body. The episode was called "Enter The Shredder".

questions.text: Baxter Stockman was introduced in season 1, episode 3. He created Mousers in order to hunt down and destroy Splinter and the four turtles.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Stockman did create the Mousers, but they were created to hunt down common pests such as rats and mice. Shredder saw the Mousers demonstrated to a pest control company and decided to mass produce them to hunt down his enemies. The episode was titled "A Thing About Rats".

questions.text: In season 1 episode 4, a trio of hot-rodding teenagers from Dimension X burst through a portal onto Earth. What did they call themselves?
questions.explanation:
Neutrinos.

	The trio consisted of three teenagers, two male and one female, from the dimension where everyone is always at war. The three only wanted to have fun and were constantly running from the law because they refused to join an army. They ended up on Earth completely by accident. The episode was called "Hot Rodding Teenagers from Dimension X".

questions.text: During the turtles' first fight with Krang in his android body, one of them was missing at the start. Which turtle joined the fight late?
questions.explanation:
Donatello.

	Donatello was in his lab working on new tools and equipment to aid the turtles in their battle against the Shredder and Krang. When Donatello finally showed up to the fight he brought the Turtle Blimp with him for the first time in the series. The first season of the show only ran 5 episodes. The season finale was called "Shredder & Splintered".

questions.text: Season two of the show opened with two of the turtles stopping a robbery and Shredder's return to Earth. Where did he end up when he transported back from Dimension X?
questions.explanation:
Central Park.

	At first Shredder couldn't remember where he was, then he mentioned being in the Big Apple. The backgrounds of the scenery clearly show Central Park. During the scene Shredder was nearly mugged by two men, but he ended up robbing them instead. Part of Shredder's plan in this episode was to start a "Crooked Ninja Turtle" gang. The gang went around the city stealing and robbing everywhere in an attempt to discredit the turtles. The episode was called "Return of the Shredder".

questions.text: Which of the four turtles dressed up as Shredder during a training session near the beginning of season 2 episode 2?
questions.explanation:
Michelangelo.

	Without warning his brothers Mikey dropped in on a "jungle" training session in the park. He was dressed in a purple cape and wearing some kitchen utensils. He used a pizza tray for a mask.  The episode was called "The Incredible Shrinking Turtles".

questions.text: In season 2 episode 3 the Shredder steals a piece of an alien crystal from two children. Why weren't the children afraid of Shredder?
questions.correct: They had seen every episode of "Star Trek".
options: He was dressed up as a circus clown.
They thought they'd lost it and thought they never really saw Shredder.
questions.explanation:
They had seen every episode of "Star Trek".

	Both the turtles and Shredder were searching for pieces of a fragmented alien crystal. The search brought both parties to the circus where they discovered two children with the fragment.  April tried to buy the crystal from the children while Shredder instead just stole it. The boy whom Shredder ripped the crystal from turned to him and yelled, "We're not afraid of you. We've seen every episode of "Star Trek".  The episode was called "It Came from Beneath the Sewers".

questions.text: Similar to the Stephen King-directed movie "Maximum Overdrive" the turtles had to fight against cars and trucks that came alive in Season 2 episode 4. How did they come to life?
questions.correct: An artificial intelligence program 'zapped' them to life.
options: It was never explained, it just happened.
It was a dream Michelangelo was having, they weren't really alive.
Some of the ooze that mutated the turtles was spilled in an auto factory.
questions.explanation:
An artificial intelligence program 'zapped' them to life.

	AI program Omnis was tasked by the Shredder to destroy the turtles. The machine sent a blast through the power lines into a construction site where the turtles were meeting April.  The blast of energy hit several large vehicles in the yard and they all came to life to attack the turtles. The rest of the episode had the turtles fighting various vehicles and other electronic devices while working to destroy Omnis.  The episode was called "The Mean Machines".

questions.text: In season 2 episode 5 Shredder used an alien gemstone to transform a Chinese food container into a giant animal. What kind of mythical beast was the animal?
questions.explanation:
dragon.

	Shredder used the gemstone known as the eye of Sarnoth, which had been the key to several early season two episodes. The stone gave him the power to both transform and control matter. He blasted a Chinese food container with the ray from the stone and turned it into a dragon he controlled with his mind. The episode was called "Curse of the Evil Eye".
